subject: Re: [junit] RFE: Make excluded.properties extensible
msgSnippet: Mike There are couple of methods mentioned in the JUnit FAQ: If you are using additional jars from 3rd party vendors you can either: update this file
messageBody:
Mike

There are couple of methods mentioned in the JUnit
FAQ:

"If you are using additional jars from 3rd party
vendors you can either:
update this file (excluded.properties) in the
junit.jar and add your package paths or,
'patch' the junit.util.excluded.properties file with
the CLASSPATH, that is, put your customized version of
this file in the class path before the junit.jar. In
this way your version will be loaded instead of the
one that comes with junit. "

I have used the former method to add my own and other
packages with no problems.

HTH

Steve

--- Mike Morris <mike.morris@...>
wrote:
> Apologies if I have missed something in the docs; I
> would like to see
> excluded.properties be extensible so that I can add
> to (or override) the list of
> packages/classes that are excluded from reloading
> behaviour. As far as I can
> tell from perusing the source the
> "excluded.properties" file is only looked-for
> in the classpath.
>
> Does anyone else feel that it would be useful to be
> able to add one's own list
> of packages for exclusion? Perhaps such properties
> could simply be added to
> junit.properties rather than creating another,
> separate config file.
